reviews.review_msg: poorly organized, bad memory about sfu
Classes are boring. Wouldnt take his class again.

Marek is a legend! Promotes students to Eagles of different classes, for example, there is a First Major Eagle (gets purple heart award). In all seriousness Marek is a legend with legendary quotes such as, "when you see a complicated circuit, don't panic on the titanic" and "my duty is to provide an error rich environment". Take the class with him!
I have trouble with his accent. Notes are very random, hard to follow. Buy text book, or you wont pass

The course was hard itself but Marek was always willing to satay longer to explain the material or available for random showing at his office.  If you are looking for easy grades - this is not for you!

Marek is a beauty. Great guy.  Always willing to help, very fair in terms of his expectations for quizzes. Doesn't ask questions about the things that seem extremely difficult from the lectures. Labs are quite challenging but rewarding.

Go to class and pass. Labs can be hard but that's microelectronics.   Teaching 325 he can clearly explain the topics better than 225 now that the students are more senior. He clearly knows what he's talking about and he also had 5 quizzes worth 10% each which helped split up exam marks fairly. His bad rep on this site I don't think is earned fairly
Do yourself a favor. Avoid him for this course please! thank you.
hard class. boring lectures. I did not like his teaching style and exam pattern at all.
Too lazy to write his own notes.only 4 questions on final only from high freq mosfets and BJT. So I suppose he thinks amplifier diodes etc were meant just to pass our time
Half of the class dropped the course in the first week of classes.The 75% of the rest remaining failed the class. not recommended at all.
Final was a killer and an extremely low average of 32%. Well why do you think that happened? Think.
it was a bad experience  to do this course with Dr.Syrzycki because he would not scale. bad. like sooo bad. like O M G bad!!!!!
Dr.Marek may be a very knowledgeable person but he wasn't able to transfer that knowledge to us and gave a really hard final exam. overall course load was not so much.
will turn out to be a nightmare. refrain from taking such an important course with Dr.Marek.
Correct! it was the most ridiculous grading I have seen so far.
TA's were more helpful in this course. Marek had zero contribution and 100% expectation.
32% average on the final exam yet he does not want to scale.
re-taking it with ash. Im sorry to say but he is bad professor! Funny guy though.
Disappointing. Avoid at all costs!!! or else be prepared for a horrible experience!
Poor teaching skills and grading is even worse
he is one of those who cannot digest that he's a bad teacher and students have to pay fr that because he would not scale. WORST PROF IN Engineering so far.

He points flaws in the textbook recommended by him. Average of class was less than 40%, but he didn't scale. Encourages you to ask questions, but once you ask a question, he doesn't understand it and then basically tries his level best to make you look stupid. Pointless true/false quizzes. Unimaginably difficult final. AVOID. At all costs.
Very hard class. He assumes that we know everything. i think learning from the book is easier than understanding him.
Really nice Prof. U have to be aware that the class itself is hard and heavy load. No quiz No midterm. If u put hard work into  ur lab, u r good to go! Good luck!

It's easy to get a good mark in this course with Marek, as labs and assignments are worth 70%. However, that doesn't mean that this course is easy... there's a lot of lab work, so be prepared for that. If you put work into the labs and assignments, you can easily get ~100% on those parts, so that getting 50% on the final still nets you an A.

Marek is a good guy. Marks extremely easily, if you get a bad grade in his class you are doing something really wrong. Final is worth very little of your grade and is open book. Treats students well. Beware, the course is heavy loaded though, and he has a bad habbit of using notes from books other than the class book.

Marek is really nice guy but the thing about ENSC 325 is the course is extremely heavy loaded. He scales a lot. It's unbelievable .you don't have midterm exam nor quizzes but he gives you True and False questions in the final exam which sounds strange for this course but at the end you will be happy with  your the marks that you get.
He may have a hard to understand accent but he is a smart and good professor. Makes class interesting to the best of his ability!

Fairly good teaching skills. Has a soft voice with a Polish accent, so it's kinda hard to understand him. Doesn't give much homework. Labs were very hard to do and grading for them was kinda unfair. This course has a LOT of material, but the final was easy. Overall, not a very hard course. Average was around 70% for our class.
Poor teaching skills, avoid at all cost.  8/32 student dropped the course due to him.
Very poor consistancy!
very sad and extremely disappointed with his teaching
Can't understand anything he's trying to say.
Whiny high-pitched voice means you can hardly understand him. Notes not good, teaching style much like ash except slower
easy midterm, but didn't learn much from him.
Almost impossible to understand. Writing dreadfully small. But test u by the textbook.
Believes in multiple choice, read his notes very carefully, bit confusing in lec
